poem:
**Rose Garden Diplomacy**

In the garden,  
white petals tremble  
under whispered hopes—  
two and a half hours,  
and counting, words twine  
like vines, the dead  
numberless, bloom  
in mind's eye. Terrible—  
each young face a bud,  
unnamed. Hope grows  
unseen, despite this  
momentary bloom.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. It’s a terrible situation going on over there. Five thousand young people every single week are being killed so hopefully we did something.“We also spoke to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
